Successful eBay sellers know that ways to get buyers competing with each other for their products may be to sell popular brand solutions. Buyers want the popular brands, and they look for them. That is why it is important to include the popular well-known in your auction labels.

When buying products to sell on eBay, look for name-brand items, list them and include the brand name in your auction title, because that's what buyers are thinking to buy for themselves. You can purchase quality off-brand items, too, and include them in auctions with name-brand solutions. If you combine a popular brand item with a generic brand item, you can call it a "lot" and include in the title the word "lot" along with the name of the popular brand. This will present you with double exposure for ones auction, because eBay buyers love to buy auction lots and they love to buy well-known brand items.

For example, you might combine a "Coach" handbag which includes a handbag made by a great off-brand company. You could combine the 2 main handbags in a listing and work with a title with the keywords "lot" and "Coach. "

Only use the popular name brand if you can verify that the company is authentic. It is against eBay's Terms of Service distribute name brands that are not authentic. If you will be in doubt about an item's authenticity, do some research to determine whether or not your item is traditional.
